title: 76ers' George shut down for rest of season
content: Paul George has been ruled out for at least the rest of the regular season after receiving injections in his left adductor muscle and left knee Monday

title: Rose win Unrivaled's first women's 3-on-3 title
content: Rose beat Vinyl in the Unrivaled championship game, capping the inaugural season of the women's 3-on-3 basketball league.

title: WVU snub 'robbery' at highest level, gov. says
content: West Virginia Gov. Patrick Morrisey wants his attorney general to investigate and work closely with the NCAA to ensure the men's tournament selection process is transparent and fair.

title: S. Alabama has NIT invite nixed: 'Unacceptable'
content: South Alabama had its invitation to the NIT rescinded after the Jaguars were informed they would be playing, a decision the coach called "unacceptable."

title: Brink 'icked out' by replies to Sparks' male tryouts
content: Sparks forward Cameron Brink said she was unsettled by the response she saw online to a call by the team for men to try out for the practice squad.

title: Deion wants foe for CU spring game; Cuse willing
content: Colorado coach Deion Sanders wants to save spring football games by having teams practice against another team for a week before playing them in a scrimmage.

title: Belichick flips 4-star Ruffin from A&M to UNC
content: Four-star defensive tackle Trashawn Ruffin, No. 238 in the ESPN Junior 300, flipped his commitment from Texas A&M to North Carolina on Monday, marking the Tar Heels' highest-rated new pledge since coach Bill Belichick took over the program.

title: N.Y. Golf Club upsets L.A. to reach TGL finals
content: New York Golf Club pulled off a 6-4 upset win over top-seeded Los Angeles Golf Club to advance to the TGL's best-of-three championship series.

title: It's bracket time: Make your picks for the men's tournament
content: The bracket is set. Here's everything you need to know about the competitors for this year's national title.

title: Your guide to all 68 teams in the men’s NCAA tournament
content: The bracket is set, here's everything you need to know about the competitors for this year's national title.

title: 'I feel like I'm a more complete player': Players win a sign of what's to come for Rory in 2025?
content: After two early wins in signature events, McIlroy's game is in a great place with the Masters and the rest of the majors in the not-too-distant future.

title: You've signed a one-of-a-kind freshman in Cooper Flagg. Now what? Here's how Duke built a contender around its prized recruit
content: In an era when teams are incentivized to build around experience, the Blue Devils built a contender with youth.

title: NHL playoff watch: The Bruins' path to the postseason
content: It's a long shot, but the B's can still pull this off -- here's how. Plus, full playoff projections, draft lottery standings, more.

title: How a 64-team college football tournament would play out
content: What if the CFP went as deep as March Madness? We picked our college football bracket and played out the first two rounds.

title: MLB's villains or its gold standard? How the Los Angeles Dodgers got here
content: Love them or loathe them, the defending champs built a new evil empire with a series of monumental moves.

title: Newcastle's Carabao Cup glory, Barcelona's epic comeback, boring Arsenal-Chelsea, more
content: From Newcastle ending their nearly six-decade trophy drought to Barcelona's comeback for the ages at Atletico Madrid, it was another brilliant weekend across Europe. Gab Marcotti has what you need to know.

title: Sargent looks to carry 'flow state' over to USMNT
content: U.S. striker Josh Sargent described his current run of form with club side Norwich City as a "flow state where everything is just happening for you," but admitted his lack of production at international level is on his mind.

title: Messi out for Argentina after MRI reveals injury
content: Lionel Messi will not be joining Argentina for their World Cup qualifiers against Brazil and Uruguay this month, failing to make the final roster after being included in the pre-list.

title: Jamie Carragher's son receives Malta call-up
content: The son of former Liverpool and England defender Jamie Carragher has been called up for international duty by Malta.

title: Rabiot lashes out at PSG prez: 'Can't buy class'
content: Marseille midfielder Adrien Rabiot took aim at Paris Saint-Germain president Nasser Al-Khelaifi following his side's 3-1 loss to the Ligue 1 leaders on Sunday, writing on social media that "you can't buy class."

title: Man Utd season ticket prices to rise by around 5%
content: Manchester United have announced ticket price rises ahead of next season less than a week after unveiling plans to build a new £2 billion stadium.

title: Antonio vows to return to football after car crash
content: West Ham United forward Michail Antonio has insisted he will play professional football again after he recovers from being involved in a near-fatal road traffic collision in December.

title: Chelsea condemn racist abuse towards Fofana
content: Chelsea have strongly condemned the racist abuse faced by defender Wesley Fofana in the aftermath of their loss to Arsenal on Sunday.

title: Club mistakenly mourns player who isn't dead
content: The management of Bulgarian top-flight side Arda Kardzhali apologised after their former player Petko Ganchev, whose death they mourned in a minute's silence before Sunday's match with Levski Sofia, turned out to be alive.

title: What would it take for Wrexham to reach Premier League from League 1?
content: Wrexham's rise from nonleague has truly been the stuff of Hollywood legend -- no surprise given their owners. But can they now actually get to the Premier League from here?

title: WNBA trade grades: Did the defending champion Liberty get even better in trade for Cloud?
content: Natasha Cloud gives New York another skilled distributor and a stronger defense, while Connecticut gains two first-round picks to help its rebuild.

title: Men's first-round betting odds, lines, spread and BPI
content: Every set of betting lines, spreads, totals and more betting odds for the first round of the 2025 men's NCAA tournament.

title: Booed in Brussels, bound for WrestleMania: Highlights from John Cena's farewell tour
content: Here are the best moments from John Cena's "The Last Time is Now" farewell tour, which kicked off at Intuit Dome on Jan. 6.

title: Waiver wire pickups: Two Warriors to add now
content: The fantasy basketball waiver wire always has players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add this week.

title: Six March Madness stars to watch
content: Eric Moody breaks down which players fantasy managers should keep an eye on during the 2025 Women's NCAA tournament.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United scouting Sesko, Ekitike
content: Will Benjamin Sesko or Hugo Ekitike be able to solve Manchester United's goal-scoring issues? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Why Geovany Quenda can be Chelsea's answer to Saka
content: Chelsea look set to land the Sporting CP teen in 2026 and Quenda's style has been compared to an Arsenal star.

title: Man sentenced to 110 years in jail for abusing minor girl
content: The court also imposed a fine of ₹6 lakh on the convict, identifed as Remanan of Pollethai, near Mararikulam. According to the prosecution, the child was molested by Remanan for three years until 2021

title: VMRDA to spend ₹390 crore to improve connectivity to Bhogapuram airport from Visakhapatnam
content: Tenders likely to be called for in April, roads to be widened with scenic features, some of the roads to be greenfield roads, says VMRDA Commissioner

title: Ayodhya Ram temple will have no chief priest as of now, says Champat Rai
content: We had asked Acharya Satyendra Das 6 months ago; there is not be any chief priest now. There is no one of Satyendra Das’s age and respect, says Champat Rai

title: Pandemonium in Karnataka Assembly over Chief Minister’s remarks on RSS
content: Trouble began when the Chief Minister, while brushing aside the Opposition’s allegations that the law and order situation had collapsed, made certain remarks against the RSS and its role with respect to law and order

title: Railways out of financial stress of pandemic years: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: Lok Sabha begins discussion on Railways’ demands for grants, Opposition questions delay in appointments

title: Nagpur violent clash LIVE updates: Prohibitory orders imposed amid ongoing violence
content: According to police, tension escalated when the rumour of burning the holy book of the Muslim community during the protest spread in Ganeshpeth, Mahal, and Gandhibagh areas of the city.

title: Clash Erupts In Nagpur Amid Aurangzeb Tomb Row, D Fadnavis Appeals For Calm
content: Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis has appealed for peace after violence broke out in Nagpur amid the row over the call for removal of Mughal emperor Aurangzeb's tomb.

title: PM Modi, Tulsi Gabbard Meet Hours After India Flags Khalistani Terror To US
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Tulsi Gabbard, the United States' Director of National Intelligence, who is in India for a two-and-a-half day visit, in Delhi Monday evening.

title: "Ballet Dance Between Dragon, Elephant": China Reacts To PM's Comments
content: The mutual respect between New Delhi and Beijing is openly on display. The latest being Prime Minister Narendra Modi's "positive" remarks on the ties between the two countries, which China has "appreciated".

title: How An Anonymous Letter Exposed UP Teacher's Abuse Of Students
content: Police in Uttar Pradesh's Hathras are looking for the suspended Chief Proctor of a college, who faces serious allegations of sexually abusing students and recording the acts to blackmail them.

title: US Intelligence Chief's 'Islamic Caliphate' Remark On Crisis In Bangladesh
content: The United States is deeply concerned about the situation in Bangladesh, US Intelligence chief Tulsi Gabbard told NDTV World today, speaking about the persecution of religious minorities.

title: Biden Faces Uncertainty As Trump Declares Presidential Pardons "Null, Void"
content: Former US President Joe Biden faces uncertainty after his successor Donald Trump has declared that Biden's last-minute presidential pardons, including one to his son Hunter Biden, are "null and void".

title: Video Shows Indian-Origin Student At Bar With Senior Before She Went Missing
content: Missing Indian-American student Sudiksha Konanki and Joshua Riibe, the person of interest in the case, were seen together at an outdoor bar before she vanished from a Dominican Republic beach on March 6.

title: PM Modi Joins Truth Social, Alt-Tech Social Media Platform Owned By Trump
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday joined Truth Social, a social media platform owned by US President Donald Trump.

title: PCB Suffers Rs 869 Crore Loss In Champions Trophy, Takes Drastic Measures
content: The PCB has reportedly suffered an 85 percent loss on their investment in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

title: NZ Prime Minister's 'Champions Trophy' Remark Leaves PM Modi Amused - Video
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was left amused by his New Zealand counterpart Christopher Luxon's hilarious comment on the Champions Trophy 2025 final during their meeting.

title: England Duo Asked If They Would Play For Pakistan. Replies Can't Be Missed
content: England cricket stars Moeen Ali and Adil Rashid were asked if they would play for Pakistan, the country their roots lie in. They gave intriguing replies.

title: 6-Year-Old Among 3 Of Family From Telangana Die In Road Accident In US
content: A woman software professional and her six-year-old son were among three members of a family from Telangana who died in a road accident in Florida in the US, their relative said here on Monday.

title: Vadodara Crash Accused Swapped Seats With Friend: What New Footage Shows
content: Rakshit Chaurasia, the accused in the Vadodara crash that left a woman dead and seven others injured, may have insisted that he would drive the car and convinced his friend Pranshu to shift to the seat next to the driver, CCTV footage shows

title: Opinion: Aamir Khan @60: Caught In His Own 'Cage'
content: Aamir Khan, an actor who once took pride in doing things differently, now finds himself pigeonholed in a cage of his own making, bound by the expectations of his fan base.

title: Tulsi Gabbard Was Asked What Holi Means To Her. Her Response
content: Holi, also known as the festival of colours, was celebrated two days before Tulsi Gabbard, who follows Hindu tradition, arrived in India.

title: Violence erupts in Nagpur as Bajrang Dal, VHP protest for removal of Aurangzeb’s tomb
content: Violent protests erupt in Nagpur over Aurangzeb’s tomb demolition demand, leading to tension and clashes between communities

title: CM pats student for innovative app that detects heart diseases in 7 seconds
content: Naidu encourages the Anantapur boy, now settled in U.S., to pursue further innovations in AI, and assures him of govt. support

title: No one feels safe in Bihar today, says Tejashwi Yadav
content: The Leader of Opposition said Chief Minister Nitish Kumar-led Bihar government has failed to contain law and order situation in the State. As many as 60,000 murders, 25,000 rapes and the highest number of killings of policemen and assaults have taken place in the State during the regime of Mr. Kumar, he said in the assembly.

title: SP MP demands PM Modi’s response on Trump’s ‘grant for voter turnout’ claim
content: The PM has not spoken a word despite the claims of interference of a foreign entity in our election process, Ramji Lal Suman said in the Rajya Sabha, adding that the government’s silence adds to the suspicion.

title: Survey works initiated for dyke wall, surveillance road along Eloor-Edayar stretch of Periyar
content: The survey is a preliminary step toward implementing the project, which is part of the long-term initiatives under the Periyar River Action Plan

title: Viral meningitis: Health department steps up surveillance in Ernakulam
content: The tests revealed the presence of enteroviruses in the samples, which are usually transmitted through contact with secretions from an infected person

title: Delhi HC asks Centre to consider as representation plea to rename India as Bharat
content: Justice Sachin Datta recorded that the petitioner seeks to withdraw the present petition to pursue the matter with the ministries concerned for disposal in terms of the June 3, 2020 order passed by the Supreme Court

title: Workers’ meet to discuss strike against Labour Codes
content: Central Trade Unions said the convention is being held in the background of the Centre’s “stubborn stand” to implement four Labour Codes

title: Double-engine govt has fallen flat in Manipur, says Opposition
content: Initiating the debate while discussing the Manipur Budget for 2025-26, senior Congress MP Shaktisinh Gohil asked the BJP to act beyond narrow political interests to serve the country; he criticised the PM for not visiting the State following violence

title: India, Australia agree to deepen interoperability across maritime, land and air domains
content: The two countries also decided to focus on cooperation in maritime domain awareness, reciprocal information sharing, industry and science and technology collaboration

title: PM Modi joins Trump’s Truth Social, thanks U.S. President for posting interview
content: In a personal outreach, Prime Minister Narendra Modi joined Truth Social, a social media platform whose parent company is majority-owned by U.S. President Donald Trump

title: Ganja seizure: Kalamassery govt. polytechnic college to introduce stringent conditions for hostel room allotment
content: The move comes in the wake of the seizure of nearly 2 kilograms of ganja, allegedly hoarded to spice up Holi celebrations, from two hostel rooms during an overnight raid that lasted until the early hours of March 14

title: A.P.’s ASR district to get second nursing institute
content: It will come up at Addateegala with an annual intake of 60 students for General Nursing Midwifery course

title: Notice to Air India over woman’s brain injury
content: The senior citizen’s family alleged delay in providing wheelchair; DGCA to hold a meeting with airlines

title: Indian Embassy in Baghdad lost many records in 2003 war
content: During the war to topple Saddam Hussein, the diplomatic office was evacuated resulting in the records getting lost

title: Centre advises reduction in use of cooking oil by 10% in mid-day meals
content: The PM-POSHAN scheme is an opportunity to instil healthy eating habits, encouraging students to prepare and consume fresh, nutritious meals with minimal oil, says the advisory

title: Central amendment to Industrial Disputes Act cannot be relied upon in cases where only State amendment will apply, rules Madras High Court
content: Justice A.D. Maria Clete directs a television company to reinstate a driver in service with continuity in service, backwages and other attendant benefits

title: Israel conducts 'extensive strikes' in Gaza, Lebanon, Syria; over 60 killed
content: Israeli airstrikes in Gaza targeted areas around Bureij, killing several Palestinians. Additional attacks in Lebanon and Syria resulted in more casualties, including children. The escalation endangers fragile ceasefires, with both sides accusing each other of violations. Mediators work towards a lasting truce amidst continued blockades and negotiations.

title: Nagpur violence: Midnight silence follows hours of mayhem in Mahal’s historic quarters
content: Rioting erupted in the Mahal area of Nagpur following a protest by VHP and Bajrang Dal demanding the removal of Aurangzeb's tomb. The situation escalated by evening, leading to a heavy police presence and use of tear gas. By midnight, the area remained tense and filled with fear, with signs of violence and several detentions.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for today
content: Stock market recommendations: According to Mirae Asset Sharekhan, Trent is recommended for purchase between Rs 5140 and Rs 5165 with a target of Rs 5350, aided by a positive momentum indicator. Bharat Forge is suggested for buying between Rs 1065 and Rs 1085, targeting Rs 1300, also supported by a positive momentum indicator.

title: Amazon and Flipkart warehouses raided: Toys, Kitchen appliances, electrical equipment seized
content: India's Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) conducted raids on Amazon and Flipkart warehouses to tackle the sale of non-compliant products. The searches revealed uncertified items like toys and kitchen appliances, traced back to Techvision International Pvt Ltd. Legal action under the BIS Act has been initiated against defaulters.

title: Elon Musk's Starlink likely to face spectrum tax
content: Starlink faces a potential 3% spectrum tax on its adjusted gross revenue in India. This tax, alongside an 8% license fee, could increase service costs for the company. Discussions by Trai on pricing and taxes for satellite spectrum allocation are ongoing, with final recommendations expected soon.

title: Talks with Putin today on ending conflict in Ukraine: Donald Trump
content: President Trump plans to discuss ending the Ukraine war with Russian President Putin, focusing on territorial concessions and control of the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant. Trump aims to secure a 30-day ceasefire proposal accepted by Ukraine. Russia demands security guarantees excluding Kyiv from Nato membership. Britain's and France's peacekeeping force offer may aid truce enforcement.

title: China welcomes PM Modi's positive remarks on ties
content: India and China expressed mutual interest in fostering cooperation and strengthening relations following positive discussions between PM Modi and President Xi Jinping. Both countries aim to implement the understandings reached during their October meeting in Kazan, emphasizing development, revitalization, and the overall progress of their civilizations.

title: Elon Musk's ex-girlfriend and mother of his three children Grimes shares the hardest part of parenting: I remember being a horror about ...
content: Grimes, Elon Musk's ex-girlfriend and mother of his three children, frequently shares parenting struggles on Twitter. She recently spoke about the challenges of putting kids to bed. Additionally, Grimes has denied writing about the "sexuality and kinks" of Fortune 500 CEOs.

title: Iran-backed Houthis claim a third attack in 48 hours on US ships
content: Yemen's Houthi rebels, backed by Iran, have launched three attacks within 48 hours on the USS Harry S. Truman carrier group in retaliation to US strikes in Yemen. These escalations, involving missiles and drones, follow a deadly US operation targeting Houthi leaders, risking further regional instability.

title: Denying bail in less serious offences unfortunate: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court raised concerns about lower courts denying bail in minor offences, despite completed investigations. They highlighted an increasing trend of such cases reaching the apex court. SC emphasized a need for a new bail law to ensure timely decisions, criticizing mechanical arrests and advocating for liberal grant of bail to protect personal liberty.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai gives ‘special thanks’ to Elon Musk’s SpaceX for …
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai expressed gratitude for the successful launch of the FireSat satellite by SpaceX. The satellite is part of an AI-powered constellation aimed at detecting and tracking wildfires. This initiative, involving Google Research and other partners, emphasizes Google's commitment to environmental efforts.

title: US concerned about B'desh minorities, will defeat 'Islamist terror' globally: Tulsi
content: US intelligence chief Tulsi Gabbard expressed concerns about persecution of minorities in Bangladesh and the global threat of Islamist terrorism. In a meeting with India's Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, she discussed the strategic security partnership and Singh urged the US to designate Sikhs For Justice as a terrorist organization.

title: Donald Trump once urged Wayne Gretzky to run for the Prime Minister of Canada
content: During a 2024 visit, Donald Trump suggested Wayne Gretzky should run for Canadian prime minister, humorously proposing Canada could become a U.S. state. Gretzky declined, preferring to stay out of politics despite past endorsements of Conservative leaders. While the idea entertained many, it highlighted Trump's unconventional views on U.S.-Canada relations and elicited some concern among Canadian policymakers.

title: We stand ready to work with India, says China
content: China has expressed appreciation for PM Modi's positive statements and the successful meeting between President Xi and PM Modi in Kazan. Both nations are ready to work together to implement their leaders' understandings and promote stable development, benefiting over 2.8 billion people in both countries.

title: Setting up of 1,760 village health clinics in A.P. under way: Health Minister Satya Kumar
content: NDA govt. resuming construction of many PHCs left incomplete by previous YSRCP govt., he says responding to a question in the Andhra Pradesh Assembly

title: Bengaluru-Chennai Expressway to be fully operational by June 2026
content: The Karnataka portion of the expressway was completed and became informally accessible to the public in December 2024

title: Trade talks between India and U.S. ‘positive’, says Commerce Secretary
content: India has proactively engaged with the U.S. to boost trade, says Sunil Barthwal; talks are being held within the framework of ‘Mission 500’ to raise trade between the two countries to $500 billion, say senior officials

title: Head to three new international destinations from KIA this summer
content: Passengers can soon fly to Krabi in Thailand, Hanoi in Vietnam and Hanimaadhoo in Maldives Bengaluru

title: Kerala Sangeetha Nataka Akademi fellowships and awards announced
content: Veena artiste A. Ananthapadmanabhan, playwright and theatre director Xavier Pulppatt, and dancer Kalamandalam Saraswathi get fellowship

title: MLAs demand House Committee probe into ‘corruption’ in cooperative banks
content: MLAs express displeasure at the alleged non-commencement of inquiries, and little or no action taken against the culprits involved in irregularities

title: Kerala HC unhappy over govt. not setting up dedicated authority for Periyar
content: “What we intended was an authority with enough teeth to deal with violations regularly and resolve them, with powers vested in it either statutorily or through executive orders,” says Justice Devan Ramachandran

title: Class X exams: Attendance at 99 per cent in Nellore district on first day
content: Parents of students break the lock of an exam centre room at Zilla Parshad High School in Vavilla village in Kovur Assembly constituency, as it was not opened till 9 a.m.

title: KPCC moves to leverage backward class heft to aid the UDF in local body, Assembly polls
content: KPCC plans to highlight the recent heckling of Tushar Gandhi by RSS workers and the Centre’s decision on seabed mining to woo two backward class communities

title: Jains to take out Bengaluru Chalo today
content: They have taken a strong exception to neglect by the State government towards their demands, including a board or a corporation for their development

title: Violent clashes in Nagpur: Section 144 imposed, situation under control
content: Violent clashes erupted in Nagpur's Mahal area, with vandalism and arson reported Monday night. Vehicles were set ablaze and stone pelting caused panic among residents. Police intervened to control the situation, deploying additional personnel. Authorities are investigating the cause, urging locals to maintain peace and cooperate.

title: T'gana CM seeks PM Modi’s appointment over backward classes reservation bills
content: Telangana CM A. Revanth Reddy has requested an appointment with PM Narendra Modi to discuss two bills proposing 42% reservation for backward classes in education, employment, and local bodies. Reddy seeks support from leaders of various political parties, all of whom backed the proposal in the assembly debate.

title: Ajit Pawar admits Ladki funds went to well-off too, vows to 'fix' it
content: Deputy CM Ajit Pawar acknowledged that financially well-off individuals received benefits from the Mukhya Mantri Majhi Ladki Bahin Yojana meant for poor women. The scheme will be corrected without reclaiming funds. Despite rising allocation for SC and ST outlay, the program continues, with a loan link of up to Rs 25,000 announced.

title: Compared to Lalu era, train mishaps down 90%: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw highlighted significant improvements in railway safety, reducing accidents from an average of one per day to 30 annually. He also noted successful exports of locomotives and coaches, financial stability post-pandemic, and plans to increase the production of non-AC coaches.

title: Sambhal cops deny permission for historic Neja Mela ‘commemorating plunderer’ Ghaznavi’s commander
content: Sambhal police have denied permission for the annual Neja Mela due to its association with Syed Salar Masood Ghazi, linked to historical violence in India. Authorities stated that celebrating such a figure is anti-national and could disturb law and order. Organisers of the fair plan to challenge the decision, emphasizing its long-standing tradition.

title: Lion seen lounging close to Diu airport
content: Lion sightings in Diu have increased, especially near forested areas close to Nagoa beach. On Sunday evening, a lion was spotted within 1km of the airport, causing traffic to halt as onlookers gathered to capture the moment. Forest officials directed the lion back towards the creek.

title: Religious, not political: Deported doctor on keeping Hezbollah leaders' photos on phone
content: Alawieh has been in the US since 2018 when she came on a student visa. As Alawieh arrived at the Boston airport Thursday, she was denied entry as CBP officers started questioning her, searching her phone. Alawieh was asked about the photos and videos of Nasrallah and other Hezbollah leaders. She said she's apolitical and she received those photos on WhatsApp groups.

title: ISI under fire after IED blast kills cleric known for criticism of Pakistani state
content: Mufti Munir Shakir, a vocal critic of the Pakistani state, was killed in an IED attack in Peshawar, leading to significant backlash against the ISI and military. His funeral saw mourners blaming Pakistani intelligence and chanting slogans against the army, accusing them of targeting Pashtuns.

title: Don't quash proceedings in economic offences without trial: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has rejected former Gujarat IAS officer Pradeep Sharma's plea to discharge him from a money laundering case, emphasizing that economic offence proceedings should not be quashed without trial. SC clarified that money laundering is a continuing offence and does not conclude with a single instance.

title: IIT-Bombay innovation to take learning out of classroom
content: IIT-Bombay will implement more activity-based learning, hands-on training, and discussion-oriented classroom interactions from the next academic year. The initiative includes voluntary summer internships for first-year students to address local issues in their hometowns. Faculty, students, and alumni have collaborated to develop these innovative teaching methods.

title: Trade talks happening at very top: Tulsi Gabbard
content: US intelligence chief Tulsi Gabbard is optimistic about strengthening economic and trade ties between India and the US. She highlights that President Donald Trump and PM Narendra Modi are in direct dialogue to find solutions that benefit both economies, focusing on positive opportunities beyond tariff issues.

title: Devendra Fadnavis laments govt has to protect Aurangzeb's grave
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis warns of strict action against anyone attempting to glorify Mughal emperor Aurangzeb. This statement comes amid controversy over Congress leader Harshvardhan Sapkal comparing Fadnavis to Aurangzeb, which has sparked political uproar and demands for action against Sapkal.

title: Ahead of BJP president poll, PM Modi to meet Mohan Bhagwat
content: PM Narendra Modi and RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat will share the stage in Nagpur on March 30, marking their first public appearance together since the Ram Mandir consecration. The event comes amid speculation about BJP-RSS ties and coincides with BJP's preparations to elect a new national president.

title: Man fights off tiger, becomes a hero in Maha village overnight
content: Govardhan Dange, a farmer in Chandrapur, bravely fought off a tiger that attacked him while irrigating his field. Despite sustaining multiple injuries, he managed to escape by climbing into a well and calling for help. He is now recovering in a rural hospital.

title: Thiruthuraipoondi-Agasthiyampalli line electrification set to be completed this month
content: The electrification of the stretch that passes through Kariyapattinam, Kuruvappulam, Thopputhurai, Neyvilakku, and Vedaranyam stations, is expected to be completed by this month

title: United Opposition support for Muslim board on Waqf Bill; TDP, JD-U stay away from protest
content: Opposition parties, including the Congress, Trinamool, and Left parties, join protest organised by the AIMPLB against the Bill; AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi says the BJP’s allies, TDP and JD(U), will never be forgiven if they support the Bill

title: South India Vedic conference begins in Tirupati
content: Vedic scholars from across Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu and Kerala are participating in the three-day event, says SVVU Vice-Chancellor

title: Tirupati police told to get hands-on training in weapons
content: We have to be ready any time to use the arms in order to ensure law and order and also to safeguard people’s lives and property, says SP

title: 121 women cadets in NDA, most from Haryana, govt tells RS
content: Women from Haryana are excelling in the military, with 34 cadets currently in the National Defence Academy. After the Supreme Court allowed women to take the NDA exam post-Class XII, there are now 121 women cadets. Women have been inducted since the 1990s but now also receive permanent commissions and can be promoted to higher ranks.

title: Person of interest in Sudiksha Konanki's disappearance case gives cops ultimatum: 'Can't detain any longer'
content: Joshua Riibe, the 22-year-old Iowa man who was last seen with Sudiksha Konanki before her mysterious disappearance from the Dominican Republic resort, has now given the cops an ultimatum that he could not be detained by the police any longer. His attorney Beatriz Santana filed a motion in the court Monday that his client could not be detained any longer without being charged.

title: Ban on mosque loudspeakers triggers return of an almost forgotten practice in Sambhal
content: In Sambhal, the removal of loudspeakers from mosques led to the revival of an old practice where men walk the streets, calling for sehri. Mohd Shoaib now takes on the role, ensuring no one misses the pre-dawn meal. Enforcing noise regulations, officials stress individual voices remain unrestricted, sparking discussions on religious expression and state intervention.

title: Join internship scheme, FM Sitharaman urges industry, launches mobile app
content: Finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman has urged Indian industry to support the Prime Minister Internship Scheme, which targets providing internships to one crore youth over five years. The scheme aims to bridge the gap between industry expectations and youth skills, particularly in tier-II and -III cities, offering financial assistance to interns.

title: Nasa reschedules Earth return for Sunita Williams and crew—here’s why
content: NASA has confirmed that astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore will return to Earth a day earlier than planned due to improved weather conditions. The astronauts, stranded on the ISS for over nine months, will be brought back aboard a SpaceX Crew Dragon capsule, with a splashdown scheduled for March 18.

title: India formally asks US for USAID spend info
content: India has requested the US embassy to provide detailed expenditure reports of USAID-funded projects in the country over the past decade. Minister of State for External Affairs, Kirti Vardhan Singh, stated that this information, which includes financial details and involved NGOs, has yet to be submitted by the US, following allegations by Donald Trump regarding election funding.

title: Pak terrorist killed in Kashmir, first of 2025
content: Security forces in Kashmir's Handwara district neutralized a Pakistani terrorist during a gunfight. The operation, which involved J&K police, the Army, and CRPF, was based on intelligence inputs. This was the first counterterrorism action in Kashmir this year since a previous incident in January.

title: Medical tourism on rise post-Covid, govt tells Parliament, launches portal
content: The number of foreigners visiting India for medical purposes has risen steadily post-pandemic, reaching nearly 6.6 lakh in 2023. Also, foreign tourist arrivals in the first half of 2024 showed 90% recovery compared to the same period in 2019, indicating a strong rebound.

title: ITBP constable guns down senior after spat over dress code
content: An ITBP constable shot and killed his senior colleague after an argument in Raipur, Chhattisgarh. The incident occurred at the ITBP battalion headquarters. The constable fired 20 rounds from his Insas rifle, which resulted in the death of the senior officer. A detailed investigation into the incident is currently underway.

title: Kolkata-born Gayatri Spivak gets 2025 Holberg Prize
content: Gayatri Chakravorty Spivak has been honored with the 2025 Holberg Prize for her influential work in literary theory and philosophy. She has made significant contributions to fields such as comparative literature, translation, postcolonial studies, political philosophy, and feminist theory.

title: How Bengals' deals for Ja'Marr Chase, Tee Higgins impact draft plans, Trey Hendrickson; plus league intel
content: wide receivers Ja'Marr Chase and Tee Higgins agree to terms on long-term extensions they have wanted for years . the annual average of $40.25 million sets an NFL record for the highest average annual salary for a non-quarterback .

title: Top 25 rankings, play of the week and what to watch
content: will Hodo beat the Crimson Tide 6-2 in the ninth inning . the Volunteers have earned their first no. 1 ranking of the season . they have a great opportunity to reclaim that top spot if they can beat now top-10 ranked Texas this weekend .

title: Women's March Madness: First-round betting odds, lines, spread
content: the 2025 women's basketball tournament is set to tip off as 68 teams look to win it all and make their mark on history . reigning champion south Carolina is looking to repeat history and give head coach Dawn Staley her fourth ring . a slew of dangerous teams no one wants to play .

title: Men's basketball guide to team mascots, school colors and famous alumni
content: the NCAA tournament is full of the usual suspects like Michigan State and Duke . every year there are new mascots, school colors and fight songs to learn . we've researched each school in the tournament to give you all the information at hand, organized by region and seeds .

title: NFL experts debate free agency: Which team made the best signing or trade?
content: free agency has started to slow down since officially opening on monday . some teams have made splash signings, adding standouts like Sam Darnold , Davante Adams , Justin Fields , Josh Sweat and Carlton Davis III to their roster . the best overall signing, re-signing or trade of free agency?

title: Lunardi: The one big thing the selection committee got wrong
content: seth greenberg is adamant that the Tar Heels didn't do enough to make this year's NCAA men's basketball tournament (1:14) the annual hand-wringing over the work of the committee has begun despite genuinely consistent selections in the NET era . this year, though: I am stumped. what coaches, administrators and bracketologists look for most from the committee is consistency .

title: TGL playoffs highlights: New York upsets Los Angeles 6-3, advances to finals
content: the playoffs kick off with a match between Los Angeles Golf Club and New York Golf Club on Monday night . the first drives in the TGL Playoffs history . Xander Schauffele, Rickie Fowler and Cameron Young played for new york .

title: The women’s March Madness bracket is here -- so is your guide to all 68 teams
content: the bracket is set, and 68 teams are going dancing in the women's NCAA tournament . defending champion south Carolina to first-timer George Mason are in the bracket . there's no clear-cut favorite -- a fitting end to this riveting season full of star power .

title: Winners and losers: UCLA’s rise, Notre Dame’s fall and South Carolina’s motivation
content: the Bruins have reached the 30-win mark for the first time in program history . they are hoping to make their first final four in the NCAA era . the top seeds are split between the Big Ten and the SEC .

title: Are any Twins hitters worth drafting?
content: Royce Lewis enters the 2025 season with career totals of 33 home runs and 104 RBI over 152 games and 605 PA . the 25-year-old has had great trouble staying healthy . he will miss the start of the regular season .

title: Avoid travel outside US, immigration attorneys tell H-1B, F-1 visa holders
content: Lubna Kably is a senior editor, who focuses on various policies and legislation. In particular, she writes extensively on immigration and tax policies. The Indian diaspora is the largest in the world; through her articles she demystifies the immigration-policy related developments in select countries for outbound students, job aspirants and employees. She also analyses the impact of Income-tax and GST related developments for individuals and business entities. title: Bombay HC slams Thane civic body for halting razing of illegal masjid
content:
Rosy Sequeira is special correspondent at The TImes of India, Mumbai
since July 2011. She has covered Bombay High Court for over nine years
which includes her earlier stints with other newspapers. Her forte is
on-the-spot accurate reporting. She tries to bring a human face to the otherwise largely
drab court proceedings and constantly looks out for judicial observations 
that strike a chord with the common man.
